query: films longer than 120 minutes in Italian

choices.reason: Contains film length and language information.
choices.summary: The film table contains data about movies available for rental, including their characteristics and pricing. It is commonly used to manage inventory and track film attributes in a rental system.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary of the film's plot.

columns.name: release_year
columns.description: The year the film was released.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: The identifier for the primary language of the film.

columns.name: original_language_id
columns.description: The identifier for the film's original language, if different.

columns.name: rental_duration
columns.description: The number of days the film can be rented.

columns.name: rental_rate
columns.description: The cost to rent the film for the specified duration.

columns.name: length
columns.description: The total runtime of the film in minutes.

columns.name: replacement_cost
columns.description: The cost to replace the film if lost or damaged.

columns.name: rating
columns.description: The film's rating indicating appropriate audience age.

columns.name: special_features
columns.description: Additional features included with the film, such as behind-the-scenes content.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the film record was last updated.

choices.summary: This table represents different languages supported in a system, including their identifiers and last update timestamps. Typical use cases include language selection in applications and tracking updates to language resources.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each language.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the language.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the language entry was last updated.

choices.reason: Links actors to films, but not directly relevant.
choices.summary: The film_actor table links actors to the films they have appeared in. It is typically used to track actor participation in various films and manage filmography data.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for an actor.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for a film.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to this record.

choices.reason: Associates films with categories, not directly relevant.
choices.summary: The film_category table associates films with their respective categories, indicating which genres each film belongs to. It is typically used to categorize films for filtering and search functionalities in a database.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: The identifier for the category to which the film belongs.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the film-category relationship.

choices.reason: Provides film titles and descriptions, but not length.
choices.summary: This table contains details about films, including unique identifiers and descriptive information. It is typically used for retrieving and displaying film titles and their descriptions in applications or reports.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary or overview of the film.
